ma9:1.2: One time, the Buddha traveled to the city Rājagṛha and stayed at the Veḷuvana monastery.
ma9:2.0: The Native Land Monks Praise Pūrṇa
ma9:2.1: He was accompanied by a large assembly of monks who had spent the summer retreat there.
ma9:2.2: Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra had spent his summer retreat in the [Buddha’s] native land.
ma9:3.1: It was then that some native land monks had finished their summer retreat after three months had passed.
ma9:3.2: When they had finished mending robes, they gathered up their robes and bowls and left the native land and headed for Rājagṛha.
ma9:3.3: They took a circuitous route to Rājagṛha and stayed at the Veḷuvana monastery.
ma9:3.4: Those native land monks then went to the Bhagavān, paid homage by prostrating themselves, and withdrew to sit at one side.
ma9:4.2: “Monks, where have you come from? Where was your summer retreat?”
ma9:5.2: “Bhagavān, we’ve come from the native land.
ma9:5.3: We spent the summer retreat in the native land.”
ma9:6.2: “Among those monks of the native land, which monk is praised by the others as having few desires and being satisfied and who praises having few desires and being satisfied?
ma9:6.3: Who himself lives quietly and praises quiet living?
ma9:6.4: Who himself makes effort and praises making effort?
ma9:6.5: Who himself is rightly mindful and praises right mindfulness?
ma9:6.6: Who himself is unified in mind and praises being unified in mind?
ma9:6.7: Who himself is wise and praises wisdom?
ma9:6.8: Who himself has ended the contaminants and praises ending the contaminants?
ma9:6.9: Who encourages, rouses, and makes [others] rejoice and praises encouraging, rousing, and making [others] rejoice?”
ma9:7.2: “Bhagavān, the Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra is the monk in the native land who is praised by the other monks as having few desires and being satisfied and who praises having few desires and being satisfied.
ma9:7.3: He himself lives quietly and praises quiet living.
ma9:7.4: He himself makes effort and praises making effort.
ma9:7.5: He himself is rightly mindful and praises right mindfulness.
ma9:7.6: He himself is unified in mind and praises being unified in mind.
ma9:7.7: He himself is wise and praises wisdom.
ma9:7.8: He himself has ended the contaminants and praises ending the contaminants.
ma9:7.9: He encourages, rouses, and makes [others] rejoice and praises encouraging, rousing, and making [others] rejoice.”
ma9:8.1: Venerable Śāriputra was sitting in the assembly at the time, and he had this thought,
ma9:8.2: “The Bhagavān asked this group of native land monks about this matter, and the native land monks gave their greatest praise to the good man Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra as having few desires and being satisfied and who praises having few desires and being satisfied.
ma9:8.3: He himself lives quietly and praises quiet living.
ma9:8.4: He himself makes effort and praises making effort.
ma9:8.5: He himself is rightly mindful and praises right mindfulness.
ma9:8.6: He himself is unified in mind and praises being unified in mind.
ma9:8.7: He himself is wise and praises wisdom.
ma9:8.8: He himself has ended the contaminants and praises ending the contaminants.
ma9:8.9: He encourages, rouses, and makes [others] rejoice and praises encouraging, rousing, and making [others] rejoice.”
ma9:9.1: Venerable Śāriputra then had another thought,
ma9:9.2: “When will I be in the same congregation as that good man Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra?
ma9:9.3: Maybe he’ll ask about a little doctrine, or he might agree to listen to my questions.”
ma9:10.1: The Bhagavān finished the summer retreat in Rājagṛha after three months had passed.
ma9:10.2: After they had finished mending robes, he gathered his robe and bowl and left Rājagṛha headed for the country of Śrāvastī.
ma9:10.3: He took a circuitous route to Śrāvastī and stayed at Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park in Jeta’s Grove.
ma9:11.1: Venerable Śāriputra and the native land monks stayed in Rājagṛha for a few more days, then they gathered their robes and bowls and headed for Śrāvastī.
ma9:11.2: They took a circuitous route to Śrāvastī and stayed together at Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park in Jeta’s Grove.
ma9:12.1: Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra finished his summer retreat in the native land after three months had passed.
ma9:12.2: After they had finished mending robes, he gathered his robe and bowl, and left the native land headed for Śrāvastī.
ma9:12.3: He took a circuitous route to Śrāvastī and also stayed at Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park in Jeta’s Grove.
ma9:12.4: Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra went to the Bhagavān, paid homage by prostrating himself, spread out his sitting mat, and sat down cross-legged.
ma9:13.1: Venerable Śāriputra then asked the other monks,
ma9:13.2: “Good men, is that the good man Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra?”
ma9:14.2: “Yes, the venerable is sitting there in front of the Tathāgata.
ma9:14.3: The fair-skinned one with a protruding nose like a parrot’s beak, that’s him.”
ma9:15.1: Venerable Śāriputra then knew Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra’s appearance and remembered it well.
ma9:16.1: After the night passed, Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra gathered his robe and bowl at sunrise and went into Śrāvastī to solicit alms.
ma9:16.2: After he finished his meal, he returned, put away his robe and bowl, and washed his hands and feet.
ma9:16.3: Putting his sitting mat over his shoulder, he went to the charnel ground to find a place to practice.
ma9:17.1: After the night passed, Venerable Śāriputra also gathered his robe and bowl at sunrise and entered Śrāvastī to solicit alms.
ma9:17.2: After he finished his meal, he returned, put away his robe and bowl, and washed his hands and feet.
ma9:17.3: Putting his sitting mat over his shoulder, he went to the charnel ground to find a place to practice.
ma9:18.1: Upon arriving at the charnel ground, Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra spread his sitting mat under a tree and sat down cross-legged.
ma9:18.2: Venerable Śāriputra also reached the charnel ground, spread his sitting mat under a tree not far from Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra, and sat down cross-legged.
ma9:19.1: In the afternoon, Venerable Śāriputra rose from his quiet repose and went over to Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra, exchanged greetings with him, and withdrew to sit at one side.
ma9:19.2: He then asked Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra,
ma9:19.3: “Good man, are you cultivating the religious practice of the ascetic Gautama?”
ma9:21.2: Are you cultivating the religious practice of the ascetic Gautama because the precepts are purified [by it]?”
ma9:23.1: “Are you cultivating the religious practice of the ascetic Gautama because the mind is purified …
ma9:23.3: the hindrance of doubt is purified …
ma9:23.4: knowing and seeing what is and isn’t the path is purified …
ma9:23.5: knowing and seeing the steps of the path is purified …
ma9:23.6: knowledge of the path’s steps to ending [suffering] is purified?”
ma9:25.2: “I’ve put the question to you, ‘Good man, are you cultivating the religious practice of the ascetic Gautama?’ and you said, ‘So it is.’
ma9:25.3: Then I asked, ‘Good man, are you cultivating the religious practice of the ascetic Gautama because the precepts are purified?’ and you said, ‘No.’ …
ma9:25.4: ‘Are you cultivating the religious practice of the ascetic Gautama because the mind is purified …
ma9:25.6: the hindrance of doubt is purified …
ma9:25.7: knowing and seeing what is and isn’t the path is purified …
ma9:25.8: knowing and seeing the steps of the path is purified …
ma9:25.9: knowledge of the path’s steps to ending [suffering] is purified?’ and you said, ‘No.’
ma9:25.10: What then is the purpose of cultivating the religious practice of the ascetic Gautama?”
ma9:26.2: “Good man, it’s because of nirvāṇa without remainder.”
ma9:27.3: Does the ascetic Gautama declare that nirvāṇa without remainder because the precepts are purified?”
ma9:29.1: “Does the ascetic Gautama declare that nirvāṇa without remainder because the mind is purified …
ma9:29.3: the hindrance of doubt is purified …
ma9:29.4: knowing and seeing what is and isn’t the path is purified …
ma9:29.5: knowing and seeing the steps of the path is purified …
ma9:29.6: knowledge of the path’s steps to ending [suffering] is purified?”
ma9:31.2: “I’ve put the question to you, sir, ‘Does the ascetic Gautama declare that nirvāṇa without remainder because the precepts are purified?’ and you said, ‘No.’ …
ma9:31.3: ‘Does the ascetic Gautama declare that nirvāṇa without remainder because the mind is purified …
ma9:31.5: the hindrance of doubt is purified …
ma9:31.6: knowing and seeing what is and isn’t the path is purified …
ma9:31.7: knowing and seeing the steps of the path is purified …
ma9:31.8: knowledge of the path’s steps to ending [suffering] is purified?’ and you said, ‘No.’
ma9:31.9: Good man, what do you mean by what you’ve said?
ma9:32.2: “Good man, if the Bhagavān, the ascetic Gautama, declared that nirvāṇa without remainder because the precepts are purified, then he would be saying [something with] a remainder has no remainder.
ma9:32.3: If the Bhagavān, the ascetic Gautama, declared that nirvāṇa without remainder because the mind is purified …
ma9:32.5: the hindrance of doubt is purified …
ma9:32.6: knowing and seeing what is and isn’t the path is purified …
ma9:32.7: knowing and seeing the steps of the path is purified …
ma9:32.8: knowledge of the path’s steps to ending [suffering] is purified, then he would be saying [something with] a remainder has no remainder.
ma9:33.1: “Good man, if the Bhagavān declared that nirvāṇa without remainder was to part with these things, then ordinary people would [enter] parinirvāṇa because they part with these things, too.
ma9:34.1: “Good man, it’s simply because the precepts are purified that the mind can be purified …
ma9:34.2: because the mind is purified that views can be purified …
ma9:34.3: because views are purified that the hindrance of doubt can be purified …
ma9:34.4: because the hindrance of doubt is purified that knowing and seeing what is and isn’t the path can be purified …
ma9:34.5: because knowing and seeing what is and isn’t the path is purified that knowing and seeing the steps of the path can be purified …
ma9:34.6: because knowing and seeing the steps of the path is purified that knowledge of the path’s steps to ending [suffering] can be purified …
ma9:34.7: because knowledge of the path’s steps to ending [suffering] is purified that the Bhagavān, the ascetic Gautama, declares nirvāṇa without remainder.
ma9:35.2: Once, the king of Kośala Prasenajit was in Śrāvastī and had some business in Śāketa.
ma9:35.4: ‘What would be a way to go from Śrāvastī to Śāketa in one day’s travel?’
ma9:35.6: ‘Now, for me to go from Śrāvastī to Śāketa, I would need to place seven chariots between them.’
ma9:36.1: “Seven chariots were then placed between Śrāvastī and Śāketa.
ma9:36.2: After the seven chariots were arranged, he left Śrāvastī and went to the first chariot.
ma9:36.3: He rode the first chariot to the second chariot and dismounted from the first chariot.
ma9:36.4: He rode the second chariot to the third chariot and dismounted from the second chariot.
ma9:36.5: He rode the third chariot to the fourth chariot and dismounted from the third chariot.
ma9:36.6: He rode the fourth chariot to the fifth chariot and dismounted from the fourth chariot.
ma9:36.7: He rode the fifth chariot to the sixth chariot and dismounted from the fifth chariot.
ma9:36.8: He rode the sixth chariot to the seventh chariot and dismounted from the sixth chariot.
ma9:36.9: Riding the seventh chariot, he reached Śāketa in a single day.
ma9:37.1: “After his business in Śāketa was done, he was surrounded by ministers while sitting in the king’s main hall.
ma9:37.3: ‘Did the god king travel from Śrāvastī to Śāketa in a single day?’
ma9:39.1: “‘Did the god king ride the first chariot from Śrāvastī to Śāketa in a single day?’
ma9:41.1: “‘Did he ride the second chariot … ride the third chariot … the seventh chariot from Śrāvastī to Śāketa?’
ma9:43.2: Being repeatedly questioned, what did the king of Kośala Prasenajit say?
ma9:43.3: The king answered that crowd of ministers,
ma9:43.4: ‘I was in Śrāvastī and had some business in Śāketa.
ma9:43.6: ‘What’s a way to travel from Śrāvastī to Śāketa in a single day?’
ma9:43.8: ‘Now, for me to go from Śrāvastī to Śāketa, I would need to place seven chariots between them.
ma9:44.1: “‘I then had seven chariots placed between Śrāvastī and Śāketa.
ma9:44.2: After the seven chariots were arranged, I left Śrāvastī and went to the first chariot.
ma9:44.3: I rode the first chariot to the second chariot and dismounted from the first chariot.
ma9:44.4: I rode the second chariot to the third chariot and dismounted from the second chariot.
ma9:44.5: I rode the third chariot to the fourth chariot and dismounted from the third chariot.
ma9:44.6: I rode the fourth chariot to the fifth chariot and dismounted from the fourth chariot.
ma9:44.7: I rode the fifth chariot to the sixth chariot and dismounted from the fifth chariot.
ma9:44.8: I rode the sixth chariot to the seventh chariot and dismounted from the sixth chariot.
ma9:44.9: Riding the seventh chariot, I reached Śāketa in a single day.’
ma9:45.1: “Thus, good man, did the king of Kośala Prasenajit answer that crowd of ministers’ questions.
ma9:45.2: Thus, good man, it’s because the precepts are purified that the mind can be purified …
ma9:45.3: because the mind is purified that views can be purified …
ma9:45.4: because views are purified that the hindrance of doubt can be purified …
ma9:45.5: because the hindrance of doubt is purified that knowing and seeing what is and isn’t the path can be purified …
ma9:45.6: because knowing and seeing what is and isn’t the path is purified that knowing and seeing the steps of the path can be purified …
ma9:45.7: because knowing and seeing the steps of the path is purified that knowledge of the path’s steps to ending [suffering] can be purified …
ma9:45.8: because knowledge of the path’s steps to ending [suffering] is purified that the Bhagavān declares nirvāṇa without remainder.”
ma9:46.0: Śāriputra and Pūrṇa Praise Each Other
ma9:46.1: Venerable Śāriputra then asked Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra,
ma9:46.3: What do religious practitioners call you, good man?”
ma9:47.3: My mother’s name was Maitrāyani, so religious practitioners call me Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra.”
ma9:48.3: The good man Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra is a disciple of the Tathāgata who’s been made intelligent, insightful, and discerning by him.
ma9:48.4: He’s peaceful, fearless, accomplished, and disciplined.
ma9:48.5: He has gained great eloquence, attained the banner of immortality, and has himself realized the accomplishment of the immortal element.
ma9:48.6: That’s because this good man gives complete answers when asked about profound subjects.
ma9:49.1: “Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra, religious practitioners attain great rewards when they meet the Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra, go to see him at appropriate times, and venerate him at appropriate times.
ma9:49.2: Now, I’ve also attained a great reward from going to see him at an appropriate time and venerating him at an appropriate time.
ma9:49.3: Should religious practitioners wrap a cloth around the top of their heads and carry Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra, they’d attain great rewards.
ma9:49.4: Now, I’ve also attained a great reward from going to see him at an appropriate time and venerating him at an appropriate time.”
ma9:50.1: Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra asked Venerable Śāriputra,
ma9:50.3: What do religious practitioners call you, good man?”
ma9:51.3: My mother’s name is Śārī, so religious practitioners call me Śāriputra.”
ma9:52.2: “Now, I didn’t know I was talking to this disciple of the Bhagavān.
ma9:52.3: I didn’t know I was talking to the second-most honored one.
ma9:52.4: I didn’t know I was talking to the Dharma general.
ma9:52.5: I didn’t know I was talking to the disciple who turned the Dharma wheel again.
ma9:52.6: If I knew this was Venerable Śāriputra, I wouldn’t have been able to answer a single thing.
ma9:52.7: How could I have given a discourse as profound as that?
ma9:53.2: Venerable Śāriputra is a disciple of the Tathāgata who’s been made intelligent, insightful, and discerning by him.
ma9:53.3: He’s peaceful, fearless, accomplished, and disciplined.
ma9:53.4: He has gained great eloquence, attained the banner of immortality, and himself realized the accomplishment of the immortal element.
ma9:53.5: That’s because the venerable asks profound questions.
ma9:54.1: “Venerable Śāriputra, religious practitioners attain great rewards when they meet the Venerable Śāriputra, go to see him at appropriate times, and venerate him at appropriate times.
ma9:54.2: Now, I’ve also attained a great reward from going to see him at an appropriate time and venerating him at an appropriate time.
ma9:54.3: Should religious practitioners wrap a cloth around the top of their heads and carry Venerable Śāriputra, they’d attain great rewards.
ma9:54.4: Now, I’ve also attained a great reward from going to see him at an appropriate time and venerating him at an appropriate time.”
ma9:55.1: Thus did these two good men commend each other.
ma9:55.2: After praising each other’s goodness, they rejoiced and approved.
ma9:55.3: They then rose from their seats and returned to their lodging.
